newsitem.title: USA: Albright to go online to answer policy queries.
newsitem.headline: Albright to go online to answer policy queries.

text.p: Concerned about human rights in China? Puzzled by U.S. policy in Bosnia? Now you can send electronic mail to U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright and ask her to explain.
Just send your query to the e-mail address secretary@state.gov and you are guaranteed a reply -- though not necessarily from Albright herself.
"I cannot guarantee you she's going to personally sit at home every night and answer every e-mail message," State Department spokesman Nicholas Burns said Thursday.
"But I can guarantee people who do send messages to her that they will get a response from the State Department."

"She will be given, on a weekly basis, a compilation of all the messages that come in, which ... we'll break down into what subjects people are sending messages about. And in some cases, I think she will be responding," Burns added.
The system was set up on Thursday, Burns told a news briefing.
Burns also said Albright would make use of the Internet to answer questions from students during a nine-country around-the-world trip she will start on Saturday.

He said she would sit down at the keyboard in Moscow Feb. 20 and hold an "interactive town hall meeting" with students around the world linked by the GLOBE system. GLOBE is a computer-based environment and science education programme linking some 4,000 schools worldwide.
